channel.title: davewiner tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from davewiner.

item.description: Politically, tag every Republican candidate for *anything* with this decision. It's a referendum on freedom. The Repubs, each and every one of them, are on the wrong side of this. Make them defend it.
Supreme Court overturns constitutional right to abortion. https://t.co/CjaVDMZp6v
Supreme Court overturns Roe v. Wade; states can ban abortion. https://t.co/HiophmYczM

Obama didn't have to accept what the Repubs tried to do to Merrick Garland. He could have waited a decent amount of time for the Senate to advise and consent, assume they consented, and walked Garland, himself (with the Secret Service) over to the Supreme Court to take his seat.
RBG was sick, and the chances of her dying were too high for her to stay on the court past Obama's tenure.
Had Garland been seated, and RBG replaced with a moderate, and assuming Trump had been elected and his nominees confirmed, the court would now be 4-3-2* which is a pretty good configuration, much better than the 6-3 disaster we're dealing with now.
* 4 conservatives, 3 liberals, 2 centrists.
Now the Democrats have to do something bold and risky in response. No more playing it safe, as is their approach up till now.
The Democratic Party as it exists now is not prepared to deal with the kind of change that is now happening. We need to be incredibly organized, and we're not organized at all.
@GregMitch No. And Obama shouldn't have let them get away with holding on to Garland's set. https://t.co/6eTd7UUXHk
What about the Supreme Court? https://t.co/4gKY1mtmF6

@jeffjarvis @pilhofer @froomkin Jeff exactly right. No one would trust Google, but we trust Amazon with exactly that service. It's what they do. Manage retail's money and make it possible to live in the mountains (as I do) without having to go to Target or Home Depot.
@jeffjarvis @pilhofer @froomkin But the NYT would squawk at the WP taking over the economics of news for everyone but the NYT (who would be welcome but who'd be the last to join as Walmart has resisted Amazon).
Jeff Bezos‚Äôs Next Monopoly: The Press. https://t.co/ZpfBryQvq1

Dear @nytimes, I‚Äôve called your support line twice over two months about a serious bug in your gifting system. It‚Äôs still broken. The second time the support person didn‚Äôt even know about the feature. What next?

‚ÄúMany [Jan. 6, 2021] riot defendants‚Äù have said they knew the District of Columbia‚Äôs restrictions on concealed carry ‚Äúand accordingly left their guns at home.‚Äù This ‚Äúmay well have prevented a massacre that day.‚Äù https://t.co/NqMSuFe1cB
@donpark What‚Äôs going to happen is desantis will win in 2024 without cheating, and we‚Äôll be back to bush 2 and everyone will relax.
Let‚Äôs all get guns to bring with us to the Supreme Court! https://t.co/5dJcnzuTFg
The pandemic is ongoing for many but not all. https://t.co/co4rXE32iw
A weird idea, but does the latest Supreme Court decision mean people can bring concealed guns with them to Supreme Court sessions?
Are there hippies everywhere?
@brijwhiz üòÄ

What‚Äôs wrong with Twitter Knicks fans? We‚Äôve got the best young players in the NBA and so why do we need to draft anyone? Hold tight, hang out and wait till next week when we can sign free agents and trade all the detritus that‚Äôs accumulated. we will be OK.
January 6 committee details Trump‚Äôs DOJ coup attempt. https://t.co/gaIPnrVxbd
@donpark No.
Has there ever been a transgender superhero?
Siskel & Ebert's Enthusiastic Review for Fargo. https://t.co/25ec38BrdU
@Schlomo you're having a bad dream.
